hints.content: Start by calculating the distance that can be traveled using only the main tank. Remember, the truck travels 10 km for every liter of fuel.
Consider how the fuel from the additional tank is utilized. It only transfers fuel to the main tank after every 5 liters consumed from the main tank.
Think about how to keep track of the fuel consumption. You can use a loop to simulate the consumption of fuel from the main tank.
Inside your loop, check if the main tank has consumed 5 liters. If it has, and there is fuel in the additional tank, transfer 1 liter back to the main tank.
Make sure to account for the case where the main tank might run out of fuel before the additional tank can provide more. This will affect your total distance calculation.
When calculating the distance, remember to update the distance after each fuel consumption event. This will help you keep track of the total distance traveled.
Consider edge cases where the main tank is very small compared to the additional tank. How would this affect the distance calculation?
You might want to create a variable to keep track of the total distance traveled, updating it each time fuel is consumed from the main tank.
Ensure your loop continues until the main tank is empty. You can use a condition to check if the main tank has any fuel left.
Finally, after the loop, return the total distance traveled. Make sure to format your return value correctly as specified in the problem statement.

questionNotes: The truck travels 10 km per liter of fuel.
Fuel transfer from the additional tank happens only after every 5 liters consumed from the main tank.
You need to handle cases where the main tank runs out of fuel before the additional tank can provide more.
